newsitem.title: JAPAN: Tokyo precious metals end firmer on weaker yen.
newsitem.headline: Tokyo precious metals end firmer on weaker yen.

text.p: Yen-based Tokyo precious metals futures ended firmer across the board on Wednesday, due to the yen's weaker tone against the dollar and steady prices in New York overnight, traders said.
Gold futures ranged from five yen to 11 yen per gram higher, with benchmark June finishing up eight at 1,347 yen.
Activity remained lacklustre in the absence of fresh incentives.
Spot gold was little changed, quoted at $387.50/80 per ounce at the Tokyo close, against $387.50/388.00 in New York on Tuesday.
